  • Open

    New BLUFFS Bluetooth Attack Expose Devices to Adversary-in-the-Middle Attacks
    New research has unearthed multiple novel attacks that break Bluetooth Classic's forward secrecy and future secrecy guarantees, resulting in adversary-in-the-middle (AitM) scenarios between two already connected peers. The issues, collectively namedÂ BLUFFS, impact Bluetooth Core Specification 4.2 through 5.4. They are tracked under the identifierÂ CVE-2023-24023Â (CVSS score: 6.8)
